subject: Re: [junit] TestSetup help
msgSnippet: ... public static Test suite() { TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(); suite.addTest(...) suite.addTestSuite(...) return new TestSetup(suite) { protected void
messageBody:
> I am trying to write a TestCase class that needs to call setUp() and
> tearDown() just once for all testXXX() methods in it.

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(...)
suite.addTestSuite(...)

return new TestSetup(suite) {
protected void setUp() {...}
protected void tearDown() {...}
}
}

> contains the added test cases in it (as inner classes). Also, is
> there a way to simply add testXXX() methods using suite.addTest()?

suite.addTest(new MyTestClass("testXYZ"));

hth

-Vladimir
